com.intel.util

Class ResourceUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.util.ResourceUtil

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class ResourceUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for interaction with Android application resources.

    • Method Detail

      • getPositionForIdInArray

        public static int getPositionForIdInArray(@NonNull
                                          android.content.Context context,
                                          @ArrayRes
                                          int arrayId,
                                          int elementId)
        Gets the position of an element in a typed array.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        arrayId - resource ID of the array.
        elementId - resource ID of the element in the array.
        Returns:
        position of the elementId in the array.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if elementId is not in the array.

      • getResourceIdForPositionInArray

        public static int getResourceIdForPositionInArray(@NonNull
                                                  android.content.Context context,
                                                  @ArrayRes
                                                  int arrayId,
                                                  int position)
        Gets the position of an element in a typed array.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        arrayId - resource ID of the array.
        position - position in the array to retrieve.
        Returns:
        resource id of element in position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if position is not in the array.

                                 java.lang.String resourceName)
        Returns a resource from a string name, rather than an integer ID.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        resourceName - Name of the resource to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The value mapping to resourceName.

      • getInt

        public static int getInt(@NonNull
                         android.content.Context context,
                         @NonNull
                         java.lang.String resourceName,
                         int defaultValue)
        Returns a resource from a string name, rather than an integer ID.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        resourceName - Name of the resource to retrieve.
        defaultValue - A default value if an integer resource with resourceName does not exist.
        Returns:
        The value mapping to resourceName.

      • getString

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String getString(@NonNull
                                                   android.content.Context context,
                                                   @NonNull
                                                   java.lang.String resourceName)
        Returns a resource from a string name, rather than an integer ID.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getString

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.String getString(@NonNull
                                                   android.content.Context context,
                                                   @NonNull
                                                   java.lang.String resourceName,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Returns a resource from a string name, rather than an integer ID.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        resourceName - Name of the resource to retrieve.
        defaultValue - Default value if resourceName cannot be found.
        Returns:
        The value mapping to resourceName or defaultValue if resourceName doesn't exist.

      • getStringArray

        @NonNull
public static java.lang.String[] getStringArray(@NonNull
                                                         android.content.Context context,
                                                         @NonNull
                                                         java.lang.String resourceName)
        Returns an array resource from a string name, rather than an integer ID.
        Parameters:
        context - Application context.
        resourceName - Name of the resource to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The value mapping to resourceName.
        Throws:
        android.content.res.Resources.NotFoundException - if no string array resource with the name resourceName exists.
